result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work, child care, and treatment to apply.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all mandatory fees and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Due to financial hardship, court waived the fine.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs associated.
Obtain and maintain employment once he is well and healthy enough for work.

No contact with victim.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavosta Deshun Dunson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.   rmm

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served. Huber privileges for work, child care, and treatment to apply.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all mandatory fees and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Due to financial hardship, court waived the fine.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment once he is well and healthy enough for work.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs associated.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial. Defendant still considering state's offer. Case passed to 1:15.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail Hearing waived.  Pretrial Conference held.  Court admonished defendant regarding his positive cocaine test and advised him that any further positive tests may result in higher cash bail. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.      No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Danita C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Lavosta Deshun Dunson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
